name: Chebakia
description: Classic Moroccan sesame and honey cookie, fried and coated in syrup. A Ramadan staple.

name: Kaab el Ghzal
description: Delicate crescent-shaped pastries filled with almond paste and flavored with orange blossom water.

name: Briouat (Almond)
description: Crispy fried or baked triangles of phyllo dough filled with sweet almond paste, often soaked in honey.

name: Ghriba Bahla
description: Cracked Moroccan shortbread cookies, known for their sandy texture and melt-in-your-mouth quality.

name: Assorted Moroccan Sweets Tray
description: A delightful tray showcasing a variety of traditional Moroccan sweets. Price based on selection and weight.

name: Fekkas (Moroccan Biscotti)
description: Twice-baked Moroccan biscotti, often flavored with almonds, anise seeds, and sesame seeds.

name: M'hencha (Snake Cake)
description: A visually stunning coiled pastry made with almond paste wrapped in phyllo dough, baked until golden and often drizzled with honey.

name: Ghriba (Almond & Walnut)
description: Chewy almond cookies, delightfully cracked, often topped with a walnut or almond and dusted with powdered sugar.

name: Rechbond (Coconut Snowballs)
description: Soft and chewy coconut macaroons, resembling delicate snowballs, offering a rich tropical flavor.

name: Ghriba (Sesame & Jam Filled)
description: Sesame-coated cookies with a sweet, vibrant jam-filled center, offering a delightful texture and taste contrast.

name: Makrout (Date-Filled Semolina Cookies)
description: Semolina cookies beautifully shaped and filled with rich date paste, sometimes fried and soaked in honey.

name: Ka'ak (Anise Ring Cookies)
description: Crisp, slightly sweet ring-shaped cookies, often flavored with anise or sesame and perfect with tea.

name: Cornes de Gazelle (Almond Cones)
description: Elegant cone-shaped pastries filled with almond paste, with the ends often dipped in chopped nuts for added texture and flavor.

name: Chocolate Marbled Nut Bars
description: Rich layered bars featuring a nutty or biscuit base, topped with a beautiful marbled chocolate layer for an elegant finish.

name: Almond Diamonds (Baklava Style)
description: Diamond-shaped layered pastries with a rich almond filling, soaked in fragrant syrup, similar to baklava.
